Description: T-shaped object of animal (cow) horn, with tongue shaped lower part. The horn has been cut to shape and smoothed on both surfaces. The object seems nearly complete except for the outer edges of the wider upper section.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 7, pl. V)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
